chat.msg: hey, q tal? empezamos el juego?
si, vamos
genial! estoy en el punto de partida junto a una ramita
¿hacia dónde vamos desde aquí?
con el tigre?
perfecto, voy hacia la isla con el tigre
¿y después?
y despues al parajo al traves de la ramita
estoy frente a la isla con el loro, ¿ahora qué hago?
al isla con la rana a traves de las rocas
vale, ahora estoy en la isla con la rana
¿hacia dónde vamos?
a traves del crocodilo hacia el elephante
bien, he pasado el crocodilo y ahora estoy con el elefante ¿y ahora?
al jirafa a traves de las rocas
me he desplazado hacia la izquierda y ahora veo a la jirafa
¿cómo seguimos?
al ramita hacia el serpeiente
vale, veo a la serpiente
¿y la próxima?
segue hacia al lotro lado de esa isla y ya esta
genial, he llegado a la isla con el tesoro
¡ganamos! *finished*

chat.msg: hi there, empezamos?
si vamos
de acuerdo, da unos pasos hacia la izquierda, pasa bajo el banco de madera y cruza el sendero hacia el puesto de flores
pero ojo, no llegues al puesto
ya estoy. a donde voy
perfecto
ahora, dale la vuelta completa y vuelve a cruzar el sendero. regresa hasta donde está el perro blanco
ok
ahora cruza al sur sobre la rama y sigue derecho
vas a ver otro perrito blanco junto a un mantel a cuadros. ¿lo ves?
estoy con el perrito
excelente, ahora sigue sobre la manta, toca el cuenco de frutas y sigue hacia el oeste
¿entendido?
y despues
ahora, verás otra rama de madera que cruza el río
necesita cruzar al norte. ¿me sigues?
si estoy in camino
bien, después de cruzar el río, vas a ver un arbusto verde
no lo toques, en lugar de eso, dale la vuelta por la derecha hasta llegar al puesto de flores. ¿lo captas?
estoy en el puesto
genial, ahora gira a la izquierda, pasa por debajo del puesto de flores y avanza hacia el gran puente donde hay dos personas en bicicleta
y despues
continua camino hacia el oeste, pasando el puente
encontrarás a dos ancianos sentados en un banco leyendo el periódico
donde debo estar
sólo camina unos pasos al sur entre los ancianos y otra rama de madera para llegar a un arbusto verde
¿estamos bien hasta ahora?
si
perfecto, luego dirígete al este, entre la rama y el arbusto
ok
sigue así por un par de pasos más y encontrarás un ciervo joven de color café
¡casi estamos! ¿lo ves?
si lo veo
¡fantástico! eso es
buen trabajo siguiendo las instrucciones

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
si debe empezar at the tent
okay, i'm at the tent
should i head south towards the dog or in a different direction?
towards the dog. between the bushes and the rock and then around the top side of the fire
got it, went around the top side of the fire
i see the red mushroom next, right of the fire. do i go towards it?
go below it and towards the blue van. Stand in front of the windshield
cool, standing the windshield of the blue van now
where should i go next?
follow the path towards the telescope south
alright, at the telescope
i see the rocks and the wooden house. should i just go straight?
go just to the right of the telescope but heading south until the reach the furthest south path
i'm on the furthest south path now
am i going towards the house?
yep
okay, i'm at the house now
*finished* thanks for the guidance, that was fun!

chat.msg: hola, you ready?
ready
great! let's start. walk under the first palm tree towards the southwest
now turn right and go past second palm tree. make a sharp left before the third tree, heading south. you got it?
ok where to from there?
now, sneak by the left side of that cute brown puppy
veer slightly left, then pivot right heading south. doable, right?
ok im below el perro
perfecto! now, see those two rocks? walk straight between them towards the ocean
big rock to your left and small one to your right. cool stuff ahoy!
ok im right in front of a crab
great! now turn right and follow along the big rock in the water
westward ho!
then where?
after that third medium rock you'll encounter a shark, no worries, turn sharp right instead of saying hello
can you manage that?
then where
time to head back to dry land, buddy
cross between the medium rock and that ball with the blue, yellow, and white stripes. keep moving north
there
excellent! sway a bit to your left now, heading northwest
towards the tent?
yes, exactly! cross between that red tent on your left and the larger speaker on your right
got it, or shall i play you a tune?
just give me where to go next
haha fair enough! now circle that tent like you're playing tag with it then head south towards the sea, but stop short before reaching the water
at the waters edge
super! now turn right, walk underneath that red kayak, and give it a friendly pat for me
can you do that?
im at the kayak
great job! now, head north – but not too far, stop when you reach the cute little green bush
that's where the treasure's at!

general_survey.answer: Lived abroad in Chile for two years as a service missionary
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I usually just think its probably because they couldnt remember the word in a certain language. I am able to understand without any problems.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: I often read in spanish and feel more comfortable in reading than in speaking.
